ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to play percussions.
I learned several new pieces and developed my language skills in French and Italian.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Private lessons are the only way of learning a musical instrument.

The focus on the final jury can detract from the quality of the lessons, I feel, because less time is spent on technique and most of the energy is focused on memorizing repertoire. I did think that the workload of the lessons was such that I was never stressed but still felt that I was learning.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn how to play an instrument, you should take this course.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student-- it's an excellent opportunity to work closely with a professional vocalist, and to learn new rep. There are not a lot of cons to being in this course, given the low workload.
